title: Newtons first law - mass supported by strings

content.question: A heavy block is suspended by a string which is attached to plastic ring. The ring is attached to two other strings which are tied to vertical supports at the angles shown. The masses of the ring and strings are negligible. Which of the following correctly compares the magnitudes of the tensions in the strings, <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub 1 equals T sub 2, which equals T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1 is not equal to T sub 2, which equals T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>â‰ </mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="T sub 3 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
